Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Methylprednisolone in Neonatal Cardiac Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: 76 neonates scheduled for cardiac surgery were randomly assigned

Intervention.evidence: Two Dose (8 hours preoperatively and operatively; n=39) or Single Dose (operatively; n=37) methylprednisolone

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effect of preoperative methylprednisolone on postoperative recovery in neonates undergoing cardiac surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of low cardiac output syndrome or death 36 hours postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 76 neonates scheduled for cardiac surgery were randomly assigned

Result_Outcome.evidence: Preoperative interleukin-6 levels were reduced by 2-fold (p<0.001) in the Two Dose group.

Harms.evidence: Two Dose methylprednisolone was associated with higher serum creatinine (0.61±0.18 vs. 0.53±0.12 mg/dL, p=0.03) and poorer postoperative diuresis (−96±49 mL, p=0.05).
